title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6018.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6018.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

When used in this Part: (a) The term council shall mean the Municipal

Police Training Council. (b) The
term course director shall mean the director or co-director of an organization
that administers the basic course for correction officers who is responsible
for the administration of the course and is certified by the Commissioner as an
individual whose qualifications meet or exceed the requirements set forth in
section
6023.3
-a of this Part. (c) The term commissioner shall mean the

Commissioner of the Division of Criminal Justice Services or his or her
designee. (d) The term basic
course/basic course for correction officers shall mean the course of training
as prescribed in section
6018.3
of this Part, which has been
approved by the commissioner, in writing, as meeting or exceeding the minimum
standards prescribed in that section. (e) The term municipality shall mean any
county, city with a population less than one million, town, park commission, village, or police district operating a correctional facility in the

State. (f) The term correction
officer shall have the same meaning as set forth in article 2 of the Criminal

Procedure Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6018.1

Amended

New

York State Register March 25, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 12, eff. 3/25/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
